main event: In November 1957, a cigar-shaped object approximately 100 to 200 ft long was observed in a zig-zag movement at an altitude of 3000 to 5000 ft over Springfield, Ohio.
interesting points: The object was observed trailing reddish-orange clouds and emitted a peculiar frost-like color,The object came to a sudden halt and hovered before moving off at tremendous speed with no trails or sounds,Two Springfield policemen witnessed a blue light traveling at an estimated speed of 600 to 700 miles per hour,The investigation concluded there was no evidence substantiating that an unidentified flying object was involved,At least one witness stated the object was definitely not any conventional aircraft.
witness description: Springfield police officers witnessed the event
